title: Man dies in minibus collision
text:
Man dies in crash with minibus in Redland Bay February 21, 2017 10:21pm A man has died after his car crashed with a minibus in Redland Bay. Picture: Channel 7 Madura McCormack The Courier-Mail Share on Twitter 
AN ELDERLY man has died after a serious traffic crash in Redland Bay this afternoon. 
Around 4.15pm a minibus carrying six schoolchildren collided with a sedan on the intersection of Cleveland-Redland Bay Rd and Giles Rd. 
The 82-year-old local man died at the scene. 
Queensland Ambulance said the six children and the bus driver were not physically injured during the crash. #BREAKING : Paramedics at the scene of a two-vehicle crash involving a school bus at Redland Bay. #9News pic.twitter.com/o2d2K7iAgB â€” Nine News Brisbane (@9NewsBrisbane) February 21, 2017 
The intersection remains closed. 
The Forensic Crash Unit is investigating. 
In a separate accident, two men have been taken to hospital after a serious traffic crash on the Cunningham Highway, west of Brisbane this evening. 
The two men crashed head on around 5.45pm on the Cunningham Highway near Maryvale, police confirmed. 
One man in his 30s and the other man believed to be in his 40s, were taken to Warwick Hospital with non-life threatening injuries. 
The Cunningham Highway, 3.5km west of Fisher Park Road House, remains partially closed to traffic and police are telling commuters to avoid the area. 
Investigations are continuing.
